intro: Asterocephalus ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous starhead, is a rare and unusual plant species characterized by its distinctive floral structure. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is native to specific regions of South America. The plant features showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a unique arrangement of bracts. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to its specific ecological niche. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Asterocephalus ambiguus is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
